content: p1 turn your work turn row 2 rs sl1 k5 ssk k1 turn your work turn row 3 ws sl1 purl to 1 stitch before turn p2tog p1 turn your work turn row 4 rs sl1 knit to 1 stitch before turn k2tog k1 turn your work continue working turn row 3 and 4 until all stitches have been worked end on a rs row but do not turn your work gusset pick up 12 stitches through 11 slipped stitches and 1 extra stitch at the end in between the slipped stitches and the instep stitches knit across instep stitches pick up 12 more stitches 1 extra and 11 through slipped stitches knit half of your heel stitches you should now be at the middle of your heel turn stitches place a marker to mark the beginning of your round if you re working with dpns arrange your stitches so that you can comfortably work your decreases arrange the stitches so that your instep stitches are all across two needles your marker should hook nicely into the work to mark the beginning of the round gusset row 1 knit to 3 stitches before instep k2tog k1 knit across instep stitches k1 ssk knit to marker gusset row 2 knit all stitches continue working gusset row 1 and 2 until you have decreased down to your original stitch count since you are decreasing down to an even number from an odd number you will have one row where you decrease only on one side of the gusset no one will ever be able to tell if you changed down to smaller needles for the heel flap and gusset please change back to larger needles now foot work in stockinette stitch until the foot of your sock measures 2 inches shorter than the total length of your foot the dk weight sock will have much more stretch than the worsted version i recommend trying on your sock before you begin decreasing for the toe the foot should end slightly after your big toe s first knuckle toe you will work your decrease stitches across both your instep and sole stitches toe decrease row 1 k1 ssk k to last 3 stitches k2tog k1 repeat for sole stitches toe decrease row 2 knit all stitches repeat until you have decreased down to 24 stitches or 12 on each needle kitchener stitch the toe together and block to your liking or throw on your feet immediately and enjoy the warmth
